marketNews.title: DEWA: Unlocking Multi-Year Growth through Transformation
marketNews.content: 1. Multi-year growth outlook from margin expansion due to business model transformation and potential additional new contracts from affiliated groups. 2. We project EBITDA and net profit to grow at a 4-year CAGR of +43% and +216% respectively during 2024-2028F. 3. Fair value Rp270/share (+47% upside), equivalent to 6.7x P/E 2028F. DEWA's valuation has the potential to be based on expectations for performance 2-3 years ahead - not just the next 12 months ahead - referencing the case of BRMS.

marketNews.title: Executive Summary
marketNews.content: Multi-year growth story - We assess that DEWA offers significant growth potential in the coming years, with the company's EBITDA projected to grow from IDR 896 Million in 2024 to IDR 3.7 Trillion in 2028 (CAGR +43%). Meanwhile, we estimate DEWA's net profit will reach IDR 1.6 Trillion in 2028, up from the level of IDR 16 Million in 2024 (CAGR +216%). This growth will be driven by: 1) margin improvement in line with the business model transformation, shifting from reliance on subcontractors to being executed internally; and 2) potential for additional new contracts from affiliated groups. Business model transformation - DEWA is undergoing a business model transformation, which will reduce reliance on subcontractors and transition all existing contract work to be performed internally. We expect the internal work portion to gradually increase from the 52% level in 2024 to 100% in 2028. This transformation will boost the company's EBITDA margin from the 15% level in 2024 to 35% in 2028F, considering the significant margin difference if a project is executed through a subcontractor (~8%) compared to internally (~35%). Besides the upside from existing contracts, DEWA management also indicated the potential for additional contracts from affiliated groups, contingent upon the company proving it can deliver work effectively. We assume new contract additions from affiliates reach 50 million bcm in 2026, followed by additional additions of 25 million bcm each in 2027 and 2028. Increased capacity and capability as capital for transformation - The ample balance sheet post-financial restructuring through a debt-to-equity swap undertaken by DEWA in early 2025 opens access to funding from both banking and non-banking sources - including financing from vendors - which can be used to acquire heavy equipment for the company's projects. Furthermore, the joining of Teguh Boentoro (Salim affiliate) and Sorimuda Pulungan (former director of PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama or BUMA) to DEWA's board of directors demonstrates the company's commitment to executing the above transformation strategy. Current valuation already reflects 2026F net profit, but there is still potential upside by referencing BRMS - Despite rallying +66% since early 2025, we see DEWA's stock price still having potential upside by referencing BRMS - DEWA's sister company whose stock price is also trading at a premium around the estimated net profit for the next 2-3 years. With a price of IDR 184/share as of June 5, 2025, DEWA is trading at a valuation of 14.3x P/E 2025F and 7.1x P/E 2026F, more premium compared to United Tractors' ($UNTR) current valuation at 4.7x P/E 2025F. By considering the potential performance over the next 2-3 years, we see DEWA can trade at the level of Rp270/share or equivalent to 6.7x P/E 2028F. Although still higher than UNTR's 2025F P/E, we feel DEWA deserves to trade at a more premium valuation because the company focuses on the mining contractor segment, which is UNTR's best segment. Moreover, given that the growth over the next 2-3 years originates from internal initiatives and execution, we see the business risk from those growth sources tending to be small. The success of this business transformation is already beginning to show with DEWA's EBITDA and net profit growing by +62% QoQ and +901% QoQ in 1Q25.

marketNews.title: Risks
marketNews.content: Several main risks for DEWA we see are: 1) the transition progress from subcontractor to internal being hampered/slower than expected and new contract acquisition being less than expected; 2) a significant drop in coal prices which could affect a decrease in mining fees; and 3) potential asset impairment along with a low reinvestment rate in recent years.

marketNews.title: EBITDA, PATMI, and Internal Volume of DEWA 2024-2028F
Business Model and Growth Drivers
marketNews.content: Darma Henwa ($DEWA) is a business entity of Bumi Resources ($BUMI) engaged in coal mining contracting. Currently, the company has 2 main clients, namely PT Kaltim Prima Coal (KPC) and PT Arutmin Indonesia (AI), which are 2 of the largest mines owned by BUMI. Following management changes in June [2023](https://market.bisnis.com/read/20230614/192/1665504/sah-orang-kepercayaan-salim-duduki-direksi-darma-henwa-dewa) and [2024](https://emitennews.com/news/dewa-sepakat-berhentikan-djajen-sebagai-komisaris), and a [financial restructuring](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/38c85d4839_d500f9b4b9.pdf) in early 2025, we see the potential for DEWA's performance growth in the coming years (multi-year growth). This growth will be driven by 2 factors: 1) business model transformation, from previously relying on subcontractors to being executed entirely internally; and 2) potential for additional new contracts from affiliated groups. We project DEWA's net profit will grow from IDR 16 Million in 2024 to IDR 1.6 Trillion in 2028F, reflecting a CAGR growth of +216%. We also estimate the company's EBITDA will reach IDR 3.7 Trillion in 2028F, growing from IDR 896 Million in 2024 and reflecting a CAGR of +43%. This growth prospect can be achieved through improving the company's capacity and capability. From a capital aspect, the ample balance sheet after conducting a debt-to-equity swap allows DEWA to obtain funding - both from banking and vendor financing - to ensure the availability of heavy equipment to execute every project. Furthermore, the joining of Teguh Boentoro (Salim affiliate) and Sorimuda Pulungan (former director of PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama or BUMA) to DEWA's board of directors demonstrates the company's seriousness in executing the above transformation strategy.

marketNews.title: Liability-to-Equity DEWA Before and After Debt-to-Equity Swap
Margin Expansion from Increased Internal Work Portion
marketNews.content: DEWA is undergoing a business model transformation, from previously relying on subcontractors to executing projects entirely internally. This transformation has the potential to boost DEWA's margin going forward. Based on our analysis of the company's performance in 1Q25, DEWA booked an EBITDA margin of approximately ~35% for internally executed projects, about 4 times larger than the margin when using subcontractor services in the range of ~8%. We assess the EBITDA margin of 35% as a realistic figure to achieve, considering its level is equivalent to the EBITDA margin of UNTR's subsidiary, Pamapersada, at 34% during 2024. Pamapersada is the sector leader in the mining contracting business. To smooth this business transformation initiative, DEWA management at the end of 2024 decided to increase internal production capacity by 30 million bcm per year through a syndicated credit facility worth IDR 2.6 Trillion led by Bank Central Asia ($BBCA). Part of the equipment purchased using this facility - which is equivalent to the capacity for work of ~5.7 million bcm per year - was received by the company at the end of 2024, while the remainder is expected to arrive in early 2025. In 2025, DEWA will again increase its heavy equipment capacity equivalent to 30 million bcm per year, where the equipment is financed by vendors (vendor financing) and is expected to be received by the company in early 3Q25. Through this vendor financing scheme, DEWA's heavy equipment supplier vendor, XCMG China, provides deferred payment terms, so DEWA does not need to make a full payment and can pay in installments over the agreed tenor. Based on DEWA management's projection, when this business model transformation is fully running in 2027F, this initiative has the potential to increase DEWA's internal production capacity for AI and KPC from ~68 million bcm at the end of 2024 (46% of total operating capacity) to 147.6 million bcm at the end of 2027 (100% of total operating capacity).

marketNews.title: Potential Revenue Growth from New Contracts
marketNews.content: Based on our discussion with DEWA management, the company indicated potential for new contracts from affiliated parties outside the BUMI group by the end of 2025. These contracts are expected to reach 50 million bcm per year and can be increased to 150 million bcm per year if DEWA successfully posts good performance. We see DEWA's expansion and contract growth trajectory running smoothly, considering the company's affiliation with a large Indonesian conglomerate and being in line with the trend of awarding contracts to affiliated entities to increase economic value within the group ecosystem. We expect that DEWA can still gain other contracts commensurate with its still substantial balance sheet capacity, as well as many new projects from related groups. Based on our analysis, several related entities that potentially add work for DEWA are: 1. Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS), a gold and copper company affiliated within the BUMI group. As of 2024, BRMS has total reserves of 5,054 koz of gold and 613 thousand tons of copper. 2. Ithaca Resources, a coal mining group affiliated with the CEO of BRMS and Vice Director of BUMI, Agoes Projosasmito. 3. Gayo Mineral Resources, a DEWA subsidiary engaged in gold mining. Based on information from DEWA management, Gayo Mineral Resources is expected to complete JORC in 2027. After completing JORC, DEWA potentially gains additional profit from the revaluation results of Gayo Mineral Resources. Furthermore, the operation of Gayo Mineral Resources has the potential to be additional work for DEWA. 4. Mach Metal Australia, a gold and copper mine owned by the Salim group in Australia.

marketNews.title: Projections and Assumptions
marketNews.content: Considering the business transformation and potential for additional new contracts, we project DEWA's net profit will grow from IDR 16 Million in 2024 to IDR 1.6 Trillion in 2028F (CAGR +216%), with EBITDA rising from IDR 896 Million in 2024 to IDR 3.7 Trillion in 2028F (CAGR +43%). Some of the main assumptions we use in these projections are as follows: 1. Gradual increase in internal work volume from KPC and AI from 68 million bcm in 2024 to 99 million bcm in 2025, 123 million bcm in 2026, and 144 million bcm in 2027. 2. Additional volume of 50 million bcm from new contracts outside KPC and AI for 2026F, followed by contract additions of 25 million bcm each for 2027F and 2028F. 3. The assumption from both factors above represents an increase in the proportion of internal work from 52% in 2024 to 69% in 2025, 87% in 2026, 98% in 2027, and 100% in 2028. 4. EBITDA margin of 8% for work done by subcontractors and 35% for work done in-house.

marketNews.title: Estimasi Volume Material Moved DEWA per Tahun
EBITDA Margin of DEWA vs. Pamapersada
Valuation: DCF Indicates +47% Upside, Bull +63%, and Bear -13%
marketNews.content: With the prospect of growth in the coming years, we estimate DEWA's fair value could reach Rp270/share (+47% upside from the price of Rp184/share as of June 5, 2025), based on the discounted cash flow (DCF) valuation method. Our calculation considers sustainable company growth until 2028 (multi-year growth) followed by stable performance thereafter. At a price of Rp270/share, DEWA has a P/E valuation in 2025, 2026, 2027, and 2028 of 20.9x, 10.4x, 7.6x, and 6.7x, respectively. The price of Rp270/share also implies EV/EBITDA in 2025, 2026, 2027, and 2028 of 7.6x, 4.9x, 4x, and 3.6x, respectively. The calculation of DEWA's fair value depends on 2 main factors: 1) the speed of the progress in transitioning work from subcontractors to internal on existing contracts (KPC and AI); and 2) the addition of new work contracts outside existing contracts. In our base-case scenario which yields a fair value of Rp270/share, we estimate that the total proportion of internal work will increase to 69% in 2025, 87% in 2026, 98% in 2027, and 100% in 2028. This scenario also assumes additional work of 50 million bcm in 2026, increasing to 75 million bcm in 2027 and 100 million bcm in 2028. Beyond the base-case scenario, we also calculate the fair value of DEWA based on a more optimistic (bull-case) and more pessimistic (bear-case) scenario. The bull-case scenario results in a fair value of Rp300/share (+63% upside), while the bear-case scenario results in a fair value at the level of Rp160/share (-13% upside).

marketNews.title: Bull Case and Bear Case Scenarios
Potential Premium Valuation: BRMS Case Study
marketNews.content: Besides calculating the fair value using conventional valuation methods, we assess that investors also need to consider the aspect of the owner or controller, which potentially influences how the market values DEWA. Using BRMS as a case study - whose stock price is also trading at a premium level - we assess that DEWA could continue to trade at a premium by considering the outlook for performance over the next 2-3 years. DEWA's stock price has rallied +66% YTD to the level of Rp184/share as of June 5, 2025, equivalent to 14.3x P/E 2025F and 7.1x P/E 2026F. This valuation is higher than UNTR's 2025F P/E at 4.7x. However, by taking into account the performance outlook for the next 2-3 years, we see DEWA's stock price potentially trading at the level of Rp270/share, equivalent to 6.7x P/E 2028F. Although still higher than UNTR's 2025F P/E, we see DEWA deserves to trade at a more premium valuation considering the company focuses on the mining contractor segment, which is UNTR's best segment. In addition, we assess that the business risk from DEWA's growth source tends to be small, given that the company's growth over the next 2-3 years comes from internal initiatives and execution. The success of this business transformation is already visible with the company's EBITDA and net profit in 1Q25 growing by +62% QoQ and +901% QoQ. We use BRMS as a case study to see DEWA's potential premium valuation, by considering the similarities between the two companies in terms of 1) controller, where both companies are sister companies under the BUMI group; 2) the existence of corporate actions; and 3) significant growth prospects post-corporate action. In 2021, BRMS conducted rights issues twice with total fund raised of approximately IDR 3.3 Trillion to finance expansion for the Palu gold mine project (PT Citra Palu Minerals or CPM) and the Gorontalo gold and copper mine (PT Gorontalo Minerals or GM). Although the contribution from BRMS's expansion only began to be significantly reflected in the financial performance in 2H23, the valuation of BRMS's enterprise value (EV) had started to increase since 2021. Its valuation corrected from its peak in May 2022, but remained at a relatively premium level until the end of 2022. Throughout 2023, BRMS's EBITDA gradually increased, but was no longer accompanied by a rise in valuation. The valuation increase resumed starting from 3Q24 along with the acceleration of EBITDA growth. The above dynamics can also be seen in the EV/EBITDA graph below, although the very small EBITDA figures in the 2021-2022 period caused the EV/EBITDA numbers to be highly volatile. In general, it can be concluded that BRMS's valuation increased first, reflecting expectations of performance growth in the coming years.

marketNews.title: Risks
marketNews.content: Several risks we see for DEWA are: 1. Execution - The transition from subcontractor to internal being slower than expected and/or the addition of new contracts being fewer than expected could result in performance below projection. 2. Mining fee - If coal prices drop significantly and remain at low levels, this could impact a decrease in mining fees which could suppress DEWA's performance. 3. Impairment - We see the potential for asset impairment, considering DEWA's low reinvestment rate (capex/gross asset) in recent years. Impairment is not uncommon in companies undergoing a turnaround, although it does not always occur.

tickerNews.title: Darma Henwa ($DEWA) is a business entity of Bumi Resources ($BUMI) engaged in coal mining contracting.
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa ($DEWA) merupakan entitas usaha Bumi Resources ($BUMI) yang bergerak di bidang kontraktor pertambangan batu bara. Saat ini, perseroan memiliki 2 klien utama, yakni PT Kaltim Prima Coal (KPC) dan PT Arutmin Indonesia (AI), yang merupakan 2 tambang terbesar milik BUMI.

tickerNews.title: Stock price of DEWA has rallied +66% YTD to Rp184/share as of June 5, 2025, equivalent to 14.3x P/E 2025F and 7.1x P/E 2026F, higher than UNTR's P/E 2025F at 4.7x.
tickerNews.content: Harga saham DEWA sendiri telah _rally_ +66% YTD ke level Rp184/saham per 5 Juni 2025, setara 14,3x P/E 2025F dan 7,1x P/E 2026F. Valuasi tersebut lebih tinggi dari P/E 2025F dari UNTR di level 4,7x. Namun, dengan memperhitungkan prospek kinerja pada 2-3 tahun ke depan, kami melihat harga saham DEWA berpotensi diperdagangkan di level Rp270/saham, setara 6,7x P/E 2028F. Meski masih lebih tinggi dibandingkan P/E 2025F dari UNTR, kami melihat DEWA layak diperdagangkan dengan valuasi yang lebih premium mengingat perseroan berfokus pada segmen kontraktor pertambangan, yang merupakan segmen terbaik UNTR. Selain itu, kami menilai bahwa risiko bisnis dari sumber pertumbuhan DEWA cenderung kecil, mengingat pertumbuhan perseroan dalam 2-3 tahun ke depan berasal dari inisiatif dan eksekusi internal. Keberhasilan transformasi bisnis ini juga sudah mulai terlihat dengan EBITDA dan laba bersih perseroan pada 1Q25 yang tumbuh +62% QoQ dan +901% QoQ.

tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS), perusahaan emas dan tembaga yang terafiliasi dalam grup BUMI. Per 2024, BRMS memiliki total cadangan sebesar 5.054 koz emas dan 613 ribu ton tembaga.

tickerNews.title: DEWA's internal work capacity for AI and KPC is projected to increase from ~68 million bcm at the end of 2024 to 147.6 million bcm by the end of 2027.
tickerNews.content: Berdasarkan proyeksi manajemen DEWA, ketika transformasi model bisnis ini berjalan sepenuhnya pada 2027F, inisiatif ini berpotensi meningkatkan kapasitas produksi internal DEWA untuk AI dan KPC dari ~68 juta bcm pada akhir 2024 (46% dari total kapasitas operasi) menjadi 147,6 juta bcm pada akhir 2027 (100% dari total kapasitas operasi).

tickerNews.title: DEWA's internal work volume is projected to increase from 68 million bcm in 2024 to 99 million bcm in 2025, 123 million bcm in 2026, and 144 million bcm in 2027.
tickerNews.content: Kenaikan secara bertahap volume pekerjaan internal dari KPC dan AI dari 68 juta bcm pada 2024 menjadi 99 juta bcm pada 2025, 123 juta bcm pada 2026, dan 144 juta bcm pada 2027.

tickerNews.title: DEWA financed capacity addition worth 30 million bcm per year using a syndicated credit facility led by Bank Central Asia ($BBCA).
tickerNews.content: Untuk memuluskan inisiatif transformasi bisnis tersebut, manajemen DEWA pada akhir 2024 memutuskan untuk menambah kapasitas produksi internal sebesar 30 juta bcm per tahun melalui fasilitas kredit sindikasi senilai Rp2,6 T yang dipimpin oleh Bank Central Asia ($BBCA). Sebagian peralatan yang dibeli menggunakan fasilitas tersebut - yang setara dengan kapasitas untuk pekerjaan sebesar ~5,7 juta bcm per tahun - telah diterima oleh perseroan pada akhir 2024, sementara sisanya diekspektasikan akan datang pada awal 2025.

tickerNews.title: DEWA acquired additional heavy equipment capacity financed by vendor XCMG China in early 3Q25.
tickerNews.content: Pada 2025 sendiri, DEWA akan kembali menambah kapasitas alat beratnya setara 30 juta bcm per tahun, di mana peralatan tersebut dibiayai oleh vendor (_vendor financing_) dan diekspektasikan akan diterima oleh perseroan pada awal 3Q25. Melalui skema _vendor financing_ ini, vendor penyediaan alat berat DEWA, XCMG China, menyediakan termin pembayaran berjangka, sehingga DEWA tidak perlu melakukan pembayaran penuh dan dapat mencicil selama tenor yang telah disetujui bersama.
